subject: Public Speaking
title: Burden of Proof
description: A 60-second lesson on Burden of Proof.

hook.text: In court, you're innocent until proven guilty. Debate has similar rules.

buildup.text: The proposing side must prove their case. Status quo gets presumption.

discovery.text: Presumption means the current system wins unless you prove otherwise.

twist.text: Debaters fight over burden before fighting over facts.

climax.text: Understanding burden separates tactical from reactive debaters.

punchline.text: Burden determines who speaks first. Know it.

quiz.question: Why does burden of proof matter?
options: Determines who must prove their case
